alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:56PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range Through Thursday... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue for the next several days. This includes the Chisana River, Nabesna River, Gerstle River, Delta River, and the Nenana River. The Tanana River has risen to bankfull from Northway to Nenana, with minor flooding occuring at low lying areas from Delta Junction to Fairbanks. Water is also reported overbank into farmland along Cummings Road southeast of Delta Junction. Minor flooding is possible near the confluence of the Nenana and Tanana River at Nenana. Small rivers and creeks in the the Alaska Range, including Denali Park will see bankfull water levels through Thursday at least Thursday. Heavy rain that fell over the south slopes of the Alaska Range from Denali to the Alcan Border the past several days has caused this high water. More rain is expected over the south slopes of the Alaska Range through the end of the week. This will cause water levels to remain high on many rivers into the weekend. A Flood Advisory is in effect through Noon Thursday from Delta Junction to Fairbanks. Please see that product for more details.
